name: 王正豪
objective: In this course, the fundamental concepts of network security will be introduced. First, the most common techniques in cryptography will be described. Second, several important applications of network security will be illustrated, including: user authentication, transport-level security, wireless security, e-mail security, and IP security. Finally, system security will also be mentioned if time permits.
schedule:
0. Ch.1 Introduction (1 wk)
1. Cryptography: Ch. 2-3 (3-4 wks)
- Symmetric encryption and message confidentiality
- Public-key cryptography and message authentication 
2. Network security applications: Ch. 4-8 (7-8 wks)
- Key distribution and user authentication
- Transport-level security
- Wireless network security
- Electronic mail security
- IP security
3. System security: Ch. 9-11 (4-5 wks)
- Intruders
- Malicious software
- Firewalls
scorePolicy:
Written and programming exercises: 30%
Attendances and in-class exercises: 25%
Midterm & final exams: 45%
